intro: Godetia goddardii f. capitata, commonly known as the clustered godetia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and produces showy, yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant features palmate leaves with a hairy texture, and its inflorescence consists of a dense cluster of small, clustered flowers. It is native to South America and thrives in well-drained soils with full sun exposure. This ornamental plant is often cultivated for its vibrant floral display and is relatively easy to grow in temperate climates.
